hero.headline: Reduce Your Income Tax Legally Through Smart Investments
hero.subtext: Understand how tax rebate works in Bangladesh and which investments qualify for maximum savings under NBR rules.

sections.title: What Is Tax Rebate?
sections.intro: Tax rebate allows you to reduce your payable tax based on eligible investments. Instead of paying the full tax amount, you receive a credit for qualifying investments made during the income year.
items: Rebate is calculated as a percentage of your eligible investment or a portion of your taxable income — whichever is lower
The rebate rate is typically 15% of the eligible investment amount
Maximum eligible investment is generally up to 25% of your total income or BDT 1 crore — whichever is lower
Rebate directly reduces your tax payable — not your taxable income

sections.title: Tax Rebate Calculation — A Simple Example
items: Eligible investment during the year: BDT 3,00,000
Eligible investment limit: 25% of BDT 10,00,000 = BDT 2,50,000
This BDT 37,500 is deducted from your total tax payable

sections.title: Common Mistakes People Make
sections.intro: Avoid these common errors when claiming tax rebate:
items: Overestimating rebate — the rebate has a maximum cap based on your income level
Not keeping proof — you need receipts, certificates, and bank statements for every investment
Misunderstanding the maximum limit — exceeding the eligible cap does not increase your rebate
Investing at the last minute without proper documentation
Confusing tax rebate with tax exemption — rebate reduces tax payable, not taxable income

items.text: Start investing early in the fiscal year for maximum benefit
Diversify across Sanchaypatra, DPS, and insurance
Keep all investment proofs organized and accessible
Consult a tax advisor for income above BDT 10 lakh

faq.question: What is the maximum tax rebate I can claim in Bangladesh?
faq.answer: The maximum rebate is 15% of eligible investment, subject to a cap based on your income. The eligible investment limit is typically 25% of your total income or BDT 1 crore, whichever is lower.

faq.question: Does Sanchaypatra qualify for tax rebate?
faq.answer: Yes. Sanchaypatra (National Savings Certificates) is one of the most popular eligible investments for tax rebate in Bangladesh.

faq.question: Can I claim rebate on life insurance premiums?
faq.answer: Yes. Premiums paid on life insurance policies from approved insurers qualify for tax rebate under the current NBR rules.

faq.question: Is rebate the same as tax exemption?
faq.answer: No. Tax exemption reduces your taxable income, while tax rebate directly reduces the amount of tax you owe. They work differently in your tax calculation.

faq.question: When should I invest to get the rebate?
faq.answer: Investments must be made during the income year (typically July to June) to be eligible for the rebate in the corresponding assessment year.
